notes: The evidence provided does not establish a normative constraint between 'bucketSizeDuration' and 'priority'. The descriptions are definitional and do not imply a direct relationship or dependency between these fields.

meta.evidence:
The Logical Channel Prioritization (LCP) procedure is applied whenever a new transmission is performed. RRC controls the scheduling of uplink data by signalling for each logical channel per MAC entity: - priority where an increasing priority value indicates a lower priority level; - prioritisedBitRate which sets the Prioritized Bit Rate (PBR); - bucketSizeDuration which sets the Bucket Size Duration (BSD). RRC additionally controls the LCP procedure by configuring mapping restrictions for each logical channel:
---
The sidelink Logical Channel Prioritization procedure is applied whenever a new transmission is performed. RRC controls the scheduling of sidelink data by signalling for each logical channel: - sl-Priority where an increasing priority value indicates a lower priority level; - sl-PrioritisedBitRate which sets the sidelink Prioritized Bit Rate (SPBR); - sl-BucketSizeDuration which sets the sidelink Bucket Size Duration (sBSD). RRC additionally controls the LCP procedure by configuring mapping restrictions for each logical channel:
---
\end{tabular} \begin{tabular}{l} bucketSizeDuration Value in ms. ms 5 corresponds to 5 ms , value ms 10 corresponds to 10 ms , and so on. \end{tabular} \begin{tabular}{l} channelAccessPriority Indicates the Channel Access Priority Class (CAPC), as specified in TS 38.300 [2], to be used on uplink transmissions for operation with shared spectrum channel access. The network configures this field only for SRB2 and DRBs. \end{tabular} \begin{tabular}{l}
